articles.description: A cannabis dispensary in Oakland, Calif., on Monday. Legal recreational marijuana sales in the state began this year, just before the Justice Department announced it would renew tough enforcement of federal marijuana laws.
articles.title: In Clash Between California and Trump, It’s One America Versus Another

articles.description: 2018 is already off to a surreal, hot fire start thanks, in part, to a lot of fire and fury over Michael Wolff's new book on the first year of the Trump administration and the debate over what's true and what's not. SEE ALSO: The 14 most mind-blowing items fr…

articles.description: President Trump’s senior policy adviser, Stephen Miller, sharply criticized the new book by Michael Wolff, “Fire and Fury,” which depicts the Trump White House and the president himself as dysfunctional and erratic.
articles.title: Bannon Issues Apology for Attack on Trump’s Son

articles.description: Sam Nunberg, a former Trump campaign aide, confirms that he did call President Trump a fool but says the full context of his quotations were not put into Michael Wolff's new book.
articles.title: Ex-Trump aide: I called Trump a fool

articles.description: Former White House chief strategist Steve Bannon said Sunday he regretted not responding sooner to comments attributed to him that were critical of Donald Trump Jr. in an explosive new book on the White House.
articles.title: Bannon apologizes to Trump

articles.description: White House adviser Stephen Miller got into a heated exchange with CNN's Jake Tapper as Tapper asks Miller a question about former chief White House strategist Steve Bannon's role in the Trump campaign.
articles.title: Jake Tapper to Trump adviser: Settle down

articles.description: A top White House aide on Sunday kept up the drumbeat against former White House chief strategist Steve Bannon, calling his comments in a new book on President Donald Trump "grotesque."
articles.title: WH aide: Bannon's comments 'grotesque'
articles.author: Eli Watkins, CNN

articles.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A senior aide to U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday assailed a new book rattling the White House, called his boss a genius and launched an attack on news coverage before a TV anchor urged him to calm down and cut off their interview.
articles.title: Furious Trump aide assails book, calls president a 'genius'
articles.author: Reuters Editorial

articles.description: LONDON (Reuters) - British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Sunday she believed U.S. President Trump was committed to the best interests of the United States, when asked about an author's accusations that he is mentally unfit for office.
articles.title: UK PM May says Trump committed to best interests of United States
articles.author: Reuters Editorial

articles.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The head of the Central Intelligence Agency said on Sunday that Russia and others are trying to undermine elections in the United States, the next major one being in November when Republicans will try to keep control of Congress.
articles.title: CIA's Pompeo says Russia and others trying to undermine U.S. elections
articles.author: Reuters Editorial

articles.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump's tweet about having a bigger nuclear button than North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's has kept Kim "on his toes" and makes clear the risks of a nuclear standoff, U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Hale…
articles.title: Trump tweet on nuclear button keeps Kim Jong Un 'on his toes': Haley
articles.author: Reuters Editorial

articles.description: In 2018, there could be a record number of women candidates. Training sessions offer the basics in campaigning, and address particular challenges female candidates face — including how to dress.
